hypothesis_content.title: Post-CPI Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major CPI print that causes a sharp intraday whipsaw (>±3% BTC move within 2 hours) but closes within ±1% of pre-announcement price, the subsequent 24-hour period will exhibit amplified directional momentum in the direction of the initial post-announcement spike, as trapped liquidity and stop-loss cascades are triggered.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Recent CPI events have shown high initial volatility followed by compression. The market often 'tests' the initial reaction later as algorithmic traders and stop orders create amplification. The Dec 19th CPI whipsaw mentioned in news creates a relevant precedent.
entry_conditions: Major US CPI print released within last 4 hours
BTC 1H candle shows post-announcement spike >3% absolute move from pre-announcement price
BTC 4H candle closes within ±1% of pre-announcement price (whipsaw confirmed)
BTC 1H RSI(14) crosses back above 40 if initial spike was upward, or below 60 if initial spike was downward
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 60% of such whipsaw events lead to continued consolidation (<2% move) rather than amplified follow-through within 24 hours.
